page.title: 15Biography (cont)
page.content: Outside toilets were common and often shared with other families. With no bathroom, most people evected a winteridge which was the clothes _horse covered with a blanket. The bath was filled with hot water from the kettle and pans heated over the cooking range. Running hot water is now in all these homes as with toilets and bathrooms. The main street had only 15 houses on either side and the road could be deep in mud when it rained. There was,and still is a police sub_station at the bottom of Butt Hill. Kippax children attended the village school at the top of Leeds Hill built in 1864. Children went to school between 9.00am and 4.00pm, with a lunch break, half an hour longer than we have now.
